Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




Group Internal Audit (GIA) is an independent and objective function that provides assurance and consulting services to the management and the board of directors of Sodexo. GIA aims to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the governance, risk management and control processes of the group, and to contribute to the achievement of its strategic objectives.




The purpose of the data analyst role is to provide meaningful data and conclusions which will be the basisof making informed decisions during the audit process. As audits have become more remote in nature, the audit process has become more reliant on a risk-based approach driven by upfront data analysis which allows for a focusing of the audit scope and gaining efficiencies throughout the audit process. This role is critical in the planning phase of each audit (Global scope) to ensure a successful completion of audit objectives while maintaining assurance that General Data Protection Regulations are followed while in support of global audits/projects.




As a data analyst, you will be part of the GIA data analytics team, which supports the audit missions and projects by providing data-driven insights and solutions. You will be responsible for:







⚙ What will you do?

Collaborating with the audit teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Designing, developing and maintaining dashboards, reports and visualizations that communicate relevant and actionable information to the audit teams and stakeholders.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge within GIA.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

A bachelor's or master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, preferably in an internal or external audit environment.
Strong skills in data manipulation, analysis and visualization, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
A good understanding of the audit methodology and the risk and control framework.
A high level of curiosity, creativity and problem-solving ability.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work effectively in a multicultural and dynamic team.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
A willingness to travel occasionally, both nationally and internationally




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Únete a CGI!




¿Quieres formar parte de una de las cinco empresas más grandes de TI y procesos de negocios IT?




En CGI estamos buscando un perfil Analista de Datos Junior para trabajar en un cliente del sector banca.




Funciones:

1. Ordenar y preparar información para ingestar en las herramientas correspondientes

2. Realizar mapas de calor, geolocalizar información y datos

3. Asegurar que los procesos bajo su responsabilidad se lleven a cabo de forma correcta y

cumpliendo con los tiempos establecidos

4. Transformar y comunicar información mediante formatos visuales y comprensibles

para usuarios predefinidos.

5. Aplicar métodos de análisis de datos para formular y resolver solicitudes del área y

extraer conclusiones a partir de conjuntos de datos y visualizaciones. Trabaja con

información preparada e interpreta datos de distintas fuentes usando herramientas de

visualización. Utiliza la información para su propio uso o para fines de reporte. Diseña

indicadores y tableros de seguimiento para el área. Facilita la toma de decisiones de

manera bajo demanda de manera eficiente y fiable.

6. Extraer y visualizar información con herramientas de Business Intelligence

Habilidades:

Uso de herramientas y lenguajes de programación, Python y Excel para el análisis de datos, visualización y automatización de procesos.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato Indefinido
Salario acorde a la experiencia y formación
Retribución flexible
Participación en la compra de acciones de la compañía
Seguro de vida y accidentes







Si nuestra política retributiva te gusta, no te pierdas los beneficios adicionales que tendrás.




.. porque todo no es trabajar...




Te ayudamos a llevar una vida sana con programas realizados a medida para nuestros empleados.

Descuentos en viajes, hoteles, cines, restaurantes, comercios, etc... (porque nos preocupamos por tu economía)

Excelente ambiente laboral
Increíble equipo de trabajo




¡En CGI te estamos esperando!

Title: Data Analyst Junior (f/h)
Description:
Sony Music Entertainment France, un des leaders du secteur de la production, de la promotion et de la distribution musicale en France, recherche un(e) Data Analyst Junior pour rejoindre son département Data.

Au sein du Pôle Digital de Sony Music, vous serez amené(e) à participer aux différents projets de sa roadmap et à collaborer avec différents interlocuteurs locaux et internationaux (équipes marketing, commerciales, Iabels, IT).

Missions:


Manipuler des jeux de données à très forte volumétrie que vous récupérez, transformez et analysez en profondeur.
Enrichissement des données à l'aide de sources externes (APIs de nos partenaires, web scraping).
Définition de nouveau KPIs et développement d'outils et dashboards sur l'ensemble de l'activité digitale (streaming, réseaux sociaux, marketing digital…)
Maintenance et amélioration continue des outils analytiques développés à destination des équipes marketing et commerciales.
Réalisation d'études ad-hoc approfondies pour aider à la prise de décision (audience des artistes, campagnes marketing, tendances du marché…).


Profil :


1 à 2 ans d'expérience minimum. Diplômé.e d'école d'ingénieur ou d'école de commerce avec spécialisation data.
Maitrise du SQL et bonnes connaissances générales en bases de données (Redshift, Snowflake)
Bon niveau en Python.
Expérience avec l'utilisation d'APIs et techniques de web scraping
Connaissance d'outils de dataviz (idéalement Power BI)
Bonus : connaissances des principaux algorithmes classiques utilisés en Data Science
Vous manifestez un fort intérêt pour l'industrie musicale et vous êtes d'un naturel curieux, rigoureux et force de proposition.
Vous savez faire preuve d'autonomie et vous aimez explorer pour proposer la meilleure solution à une problématique posée.
Vous maîtrisez l'Anglais à l'écrit comme à l'oral.


Poste à pourvoir en CDI dans nos locaux de Paris

Sony Music s'engage à garantir l'égalité des chances en matière d'emploi, sans tenir compte de l'origine, du sexe, des mœurs, de l'orientation sexuelle, du genre, de l'âge, de la situation de famille, de l'état de grossesse, des opinions politiques, des activités syndicales, des convictions religieuses, de l'apparence physique, du nom de famille, du lieu de résidence, de l'état de santé, ou/et du handicap.

Politique de confidentialité

Veuillez cliquer ici pour lire et accepter notre politique de confidentialité avant de commencer le processus de recrutement

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.




We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.




Job Title: MI/Data Analyst




Job Description




Responsible for creations and amendment of performance reporting for Fiserv Operations team and clients.
Utilise data to highlight trends and opportunities, delivering key messages to leadership team to impact continuous improvement plans.
Maintain control framework around report/dashboard design and delivery, ensuring risk mitigation and consistent delivery of MI Suite.
Develop and maintain ETL data extraction packages, focused on flexible reporting for BI solution.
Develop new data sources to enrich existing customer interaction insight to support customer centric processes.




Scope of Job




Develop dashboards and reporting suite to analyse and inform business decisions. Adding personal insight to guide senior leader’s strategic roadmap.




Job Requirements




Relevant work experience considered an acceptable substitute for the education requirement.
Experience working with employee-based performance data, including standard deviation and other assessment methods.
Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Math qualification, preferred, not essential.
German speaker




Competencies




Measure Effectiveness of solutions
A high level of mathematical ability
The ability to analyse, model and interpret data
Problem-solving skills
Written and verbal communication skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to deliver multiple high priority projects simultaneously




What you should know about us:




Fiserv is a global leader in payments and financial technology with more than 40,000 associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As one of Fortune® magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies™" 9 of the last 10 years, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg’s Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to innovation and excellence.




Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:




We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Estágio | Data Analyst
HTML:
QUEM SOMOS?


Uma das maiores seguradoras do mundo, temos como pilar a sustentabilidade e o cuidado com as pessoas. Possuímos um amplo portfólio de produtos e diversas unidades em que atuamos: Investimentos, Consórcios, Capitalização, Previdência e Vida Resgatável, Saúde, Seguros e Assistência.

Com presença em mais de 100 países nos cinco continentes, somamos mais de 34 mil colaboradores em todo o mundo, mais de 300 em Portugal.

Trabalhamos para construir o futuro e estamos comprometidos com a inovação.

Estamo-nos a transformar para acompanhar os nossos clientes também no mundo digital.

A Fundación MAPFRE, instituição sem fins lucrativos, é a nossa acionista maioritária, o que fortalece a nossa independência e estabilidade. Entre os nossos compromissos está a valorização e apoio à diversidade e inclusão, construindo ambientes mais acolhedores. A presença de mulheres em cargo de gestão e o equilíbrio racial e de género na constituição das equipas é a nossa prioridade.


👉 O que Oferecemos:


A MAPFRE é feita de pessoas, por isso retribuímos da melhor maneira possível o comprometimento dos nossos Estagiários, que contam com:

  • Estágio de Duração 1 ano;
  • Remuneração fixa;
  • Carga de trabalho: 35h/semanais;
  • 25 dias de férias ano;
  • Horário flexível;
  • Cursos e formações presenciais e Elearning na nossa plataforma digital, Universidade Corporativa MAPFRE. Lembrando que a MAPFRE é uma empresa global, o crescimento vai além das barreiras territoriais!
  • Integração numa equipa experiente e dinâmica;
  • Possibilidade de integrar o nosso programa de voluntariado.


👉 Perfil Pretendido:


  • Licenciatura nas áreas de Data Analytics, Data Science, Tecnologia, Gestão ou Matemática;
  • Conhecimento de linguagens de programação, sendo valorizados conhecimentos em SAS e/ou SQL (preferencial);
  • Competências de análise estatística com recurso a SAS ou outra ferramenta equivalente (preferencial);
  • Conhecimento de ferramentas Microsoft;
  • Interesse/Conhecimento de metodologias Agile – Scrum;
  • Trabalho colaborativo e espírito curioso.


👉 Principais Atividades:


  • Segmentação e preparação de bases de dados;
  • Elaboração de relatórios de acompanhamento;
  • Atualização e divulgação de relatórios mensais de acompanhamento da atividade;
  • Análise de Dados e de Indicadores relevantes para o negócio;
  • Elaboração de Reports de seguimento técnico;
  • Desenvolvimento de estudos pertinentes de apoio à decisão estratégica da companhia.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:


  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.



How we’d like you to be:

  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Basic to intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python) is an advantage;
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau) is an advantage;
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.




What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Lisbon. 100% On-site position




(NOTE: all certificates must be attached to the application in order to be consider)




The BI Business Analyst will integrate our Quality Department and play a key role in analyzing data and generating actionable insights to drive organisational decision-making.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify their data needs and define clear analytics objectives that support business goals.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable analytics frameworks, leveraging SQL and Power BI to extract, transform, and analyse datasets.
Create compelling, clear, concise reports and dashboards using Power BI, ensuring business users can easily understand and act upon the insights provided.
Conduct data validation and error-checking processes to guarantee the reliability and accuracy of analytics outputs, thereby upholding the trust in data-driven decision-making.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data to provide actionable insights that guide business strategies and decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data analysis needs and provide guidance on how best to use data to achieve objectives.
Keeping up to date with emerging trends and technologies in BI and data analysis and continually looking for ways to improve the organisation's data analysis processes and practices.




Requirements

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analysis or related fields.
+1 year of experience in Power BI for developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in a corporate environment.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis results clearly and understandably.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong focus on results.
Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).




We Offer:

Attractive salary package;
Vibrant culture, in a company that is actively involved in social responsibility;
Integration in a dynamic, passionate and enthusiastic team;
Equal opportunity mindset and encouragement to be innovative;
Personal and professional development;
Contact to a demanding industry with challenging projects;
Company-sponsored events, parties and concerts;




Enjoy the unique experience of working at MULTIVISION! If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV and certificates (mandatory) motivation letter.







MULTIVISION is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We value diversity at our company regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
The Marketing department aims to encourage the world to be as enthusiastic about our products as we are. We have more than twenty different teams with specific areas of focus. Our teams are sharp, highly skilled, and data-driven, focusing on customer acquisition and monetization initiatives.

Main Responsibilities

  • Work mainly on SEO and Paid channels data;
  • Help to define and calculate KPIs and key metrics for the teams, monitor them in automated reports and dashboards;
  • Analyse users and product to find new business opportunities and areas for improvement;
  • Execute ad-hoc analyses;
  • Present insights to SEO, Paid teams;
  • Build, support and replicate data structures (including database structures, table building, reporting, data visualization, regression analysis, time series, etc.)




Core Requirements

  • Experience in e-commerce, SaaS or digital marketing environment;
  • Solid understanding and experience of SQL (Google BigQuery as an advantage) and Python or R (for data modeling and general development);
  • Strong communication skills, a proactive approach, analytical problem-solving abilities, and a collaborative mindset, being an effective and versatile team player;
  • Experience with Google Analytics;
  • Proven experience with various data visualization and statistical analysis methods;
  • Experience with a/b testing analysis is a plus




Salary Range


  • Gross Salary 2980-4300 EUR/Month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.

NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand, at no charge;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, sports access card, online workouts, consultations, programs to improve mental health to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
At ScaleneWorks People Solutions, we're more than recruiters; we're career architects dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with top-tier opportunities. Backed by industry experts, we prioritize relationships, offer global opportunities, and champion your success every step of the way.

Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




We are looking for a SQL Data analyst, for our well-known client from the IT industry.

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Type of Work: [hybrid] – (3 days WFO), [perm]




Responsibilities:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.




Requirements:

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases
Solid Python knowledge
Java is a plus but not essential
Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets
Experience in data modeling for analytics
Familiarity with predictive models
Good understanding of Data Architecture
Experience with Azure products
Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords
Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms




Languages: English (advanced)




Nice to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.




Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




Ready to Take the Next Step? If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with ScalenWorks, we'd love to hear from you! Submit your resume and let's work together to unlock new possibilities and redefine success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


Job Description

In this role, you will be part of a small, entrepreneurial, and agile global team that is focused on leveraging data, analytics and technology at scale to accelerate the growth of our core products in key geographies. We work closely and collaboratively, meeting at the office every working day to connect in-person, problem-solve, and iterate quickly to drive results.

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with colleagues from around the world and make a tangible difference to help bring our innovative products to more patients faster.

Key Responsibilities


As a Data Analyst, you will be working with data from various sources across the company to continue to deepen our understanding of what drives the company’s performance, explore innovative angles to systematically look at & drive our business, and surface opportunities that will help propel Sobi’s growth journey.
You will generate insights with the potential to be leveraged at all levels of the organization – from CEO to business leaders in our affiliates globally.
You will also play an important role in designing & developing digital solutions to equip our field force, power their decision making and enable their agility, bringing your analytical work to life at scale across the company.


Reporting to: Analytics Manager, Strategy Implementation and Global Data & Analytics.

Qualifications

About you

As a person, you should be a team player driven to make a tangible contribution to the company, and be able to manage and prioritize between multiple workstreams depending on business opportunities which could change quickly.

You should be curious, eager to continuously grow and to constantly push the data & analytics envelope and help the company reach its next level(s).

In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.


A top tier university degree in a relevant field (e.g. economics, business, science, or engineering)
Applicable work experience (1-3 years) from data analytics and data visualization (pharma/healthcare industry experience is a plus)
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, VBA)
A good understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation using a programming language (preferably R)
Proficiency with a visualization tool (preferably QlikSense)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in verbal and written English (Swedish is not required)


Additional Information

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Misión: Como Data Analyst, serás responsable de construir y gestionar soluciones de monitorización que abarcan el rendimiento de aplicaciones, eventos LOG y KPI BAU. Tu misión será desarrollar pipelines de datos con PySpark, crear cubos tabulares usando Analysis Services (DAX) y diseñar cuadros de mando efectivos con Power BI. Deberás evaluar las necesidades, coordinar con equipos de terceros y asegurar la implementación de medidas de seguridad y control de acceso, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad del servicio y proporcionar información valiosa a través de soluciones de datos robustas.




Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:

Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en la construcción y gestión de pipelines de datos.
Experiencia práctica en Databricks, Azure Analysis Services y Power BI.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de datos utilizando PySpark.
Capacidad para crear cubos tabulares con Analysis Services (DAX).
Habilidad para diseñar cuadros de mando utilizando Power BI.




Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




¡IMPRESCINDIBLE! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
MODALIDAD: Trabajo Híbrido - Madrid, modelo híbrido de 2 días en oficina.
TEAM BUILDING: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.
SEGUIMIENTO CONTINUO: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.
DEPARTAMENTO DE CARRERAS Y FORMACIÓN ¿Quieres dar el siguiente paso? ¡Te ayudamos!
EVENTOS ESPECIALES: Cena de verano, Cena de Navidad y Día Solidario.
DÍA CUMPLEAÑOS LIBRE: ¡disfrútalo cómo, dónde y con quién quieras!
AYUDAS en guarderías, KM e idiomas.En K-LAGAN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.




¿Crees que podría ser interesante para ti?




¡Apúntate!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Will be working with SQL databases
You will be mentored and have support in further learning and developing your technical skills
Analyze and translate functional specifications /user stories into technical specifications
Research and introduce new technologies and solutions
Implement Proof of Concepts and drive solutions through their full life-cycle
Design, develop and deploy pipelines
Create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications
Develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues
Participate in defining policies & procedures (cloud adoption, write documentations & guides)



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must


Experience Desirable


SQL knowledge is an advantage
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events

  • You will be mentored and have support in further learning and developing your technical skills
  • Analyze and translate functional specifications /user stories into technical specifications
  • Research and introduce new technologies and solutions
  • Implement Proof of Concepts and drive solutions through their full life-cycle
  • Design, develop and deploy pipelines
  • Create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications
  • Develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues
  • Participate in defining policies & procedures (cloud adoption, write documentations & guides)


Requirements

  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
  • Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
  • English is a must

Experience Desirable

  • SQL knowledge is an advantage
  • Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
  • Knowledge or previous experience in solution design


Benefits

  • Private medical insurance 
  • Training on market trends and client needs 
  • Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
  • Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
  • 21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
  • 3 days sick leave without medical proof off
  • 1 day for your Birthday off 
  • 0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
  • Competitive salary package
  • Quarterly fun budget for team events

Title: Strategic Data Analyst (All Genders)
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Strategic Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be the driving force behind our data-driven decision-making processes, translating complex data into actionable insights. This role is critical for driving strategic initiatives and supporting our organisation's growth.




What will you be doing

You develop and maintain efficient controls to ensure the integrity, accuracy, and completeness of data
You ensure our data environments and platforms remain fit for purpose, supporting management insights, shaping strategy, and facilitating operational processes
You conduct focused analysis on Commercial and Credit Risk outcomes, providing strategic insights
You identify opportunities to enhance and streamline our data strategy
You actively participate in data initiatives and projects
You collaborate effectively with peers and the management team to achieve shared business objectives
You present and communicate results to Senior Management, driving stakeholder discussions
You support line management in delivering functional strategy and objectives, contributing to the development of a high-performing team
You create points of certainty, giving greater confidence to senior stakeholders in driving strategy and decisions




What we are looking for

You hold a degree/diploma or equivalent in an analytical, quantitative, or business-related discipline
You have a proven track record of delivering accurate results within tight deadlines
You possess excellent oral and written communication skills in English and are able to translate insights into a coherent story that drives action
You have a working knowledge of data management environments, tools, and processes (e.g., ETL, data architecture, models, schema structure, visualization solutions)
You are proficient in SAS/SQL at an advanced user level or a suitable alternative language
You can clearly present and visualize the results of data analysis in a way that is easy for others to understand, delivering accurate results within tight deadlines




What you can expect at Barclays

A competitive base salary
Homeoffice (60%remote/40% onsite)
A flexible budget to use at your discretion (payments to employee savings schemes and other solutions)
Significant employer contributions into a company pension scheme
Company sports and fitness activities at special rates
Bonuses on special occasions
Up to 8 free tickets per season for the Barclays Arena
30 days leave (for a 5-day week)
2 work days available for community involvement, charity work or social outreach




Apply now

We're looking for colleagues who are bursting with new ideas and are also full of energy to put them into practice. If you're interested in joining our dynamic team and helping Barclays develop, we would love to meet you. Please send your application with all required documentation (CV, certificates & references).




What Barclays is all about

People are at the heart of everything we do at Barclays — both our customers and our employees. Giving people the opportunity to realise their full potential is incredibly important to us. Each and every one of our employees helps shape and enrich our unique corporate culture. A creative and diverse team is precisely what makes our mission possible, which is to reinvent payments and finance and give people the freedom to live how they want. More than 1.5 million customers are already benefiting from our renowned credit cards, installment loans and even our brand-new financing offer in partnership with Amazon. It's no surprise then that we're one of Germany's leading online banks with more than 700 colleagues in Hamburg.

Title: Junior Consultant – Process Data Analyst
Description:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.




For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.




Role Overview




We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:




Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
Analyzing and interpreting the findings
Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations




Required Technical Skills & Experience:




Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Data Analyst
Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Experience in process analysis and improvement




Preferential requirements are:




1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:

Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…) is a plus
Knowledge of Python highly appreciated




Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.




Protiviti is an equal opportunity employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We establish an open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment process that ensures equal opportunities to all job applicants, free of any direct or indirect discrimination, in compliance with best international standards and applicable law (including but not limited to L. 903/77).

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst (eDD)
Description:
Job Description

This role is accountable for activities related to Quality checks (Acid tests, Primary testing of data, Retailer Accreditation) from receipt of the data to data loading into the system for data sources that Nielseniq receives. Data Analysts will be responsible for onboarding \ setting up, upload and monitoring data (all Data types) into the ingestion platform \ other input platforms. This role is also responsible for monitoring, cleansing, classification & verification of received data, managing metadata, Troubleshooting, and handling Client queries.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Quality Testing - support all sourcing Teams, operations and Product Leadership with any requests around data quality testing for new / prospective Suppliers
Run Quality checks and provide feedback (Such as Acid test, Retailer Accreditation / other defined quality protocols) on sample data as requested.
Data Onboarding - understand the data format agreed with the Supplier as per the contract and complete set up on Ingestion/ any other Input platform
Data cleaning, verification and classification as needed
Upload of received files to platform as needed
Regularly update Supplier KPIs on data timeliness and Quality (RIS)
Engage with Supplier SPOC - in case data not received on time or issues with the data


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree or technical institute degree / Degrees in statistics/ Data Analytics or equivalent work experience
1-2 years of relevant professional work experience.
Understanding of various data and file formats
Ability to interpret different data structures and mapping


ESSENTIAL SKILLS:


Experience dealing with large amounts of data (TBs) - troubleshooting data issues
Excellent organizational skills & ability to strictly follow schedules
Advanced Excel skills
R, Sql & Python basic knowledge (At least one out of R, Python, SQL ) is an advantage
Strong technical knowledge and business interpretation of data
General NIQ Systems understanding will be a “+”
Advanced in English and Latvian
Good communication skills; excellent analytical skills and detail oriented


WHAT DO WE OFFER?


Private Health Insurance compensation package (after the probation period)
Hybrid working model
Corporate training and development
Volunteer time off


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be data-driven and analytical support for global and local clients from FMCG and Tech & Durables industries. An Insight Analyst will be in support of one or several clients, working with internal stakeholders from client-facing NIQ teams, operating as part of a broader international community, working towards a common goal of supporting the clients in achieving their strategic business objectives thanks to insights & recommendations that are critical to our clients' success.

Responsibilities

Supporting internal NIQ stakeholders (Consultants, Account Development, local Insights Teams etc.) in their day-to-day work with the client by:


Building a strong partnership with your internal clients to make an impact delivering best in class projects, managing expectations and priorities following the aligned ways of working
Focusing on stakeholder satisfaction and cultivating productive, long-term connections
Fostering a strong understanding of your clients’ business priorities  
Executing projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data and consumer data, writing client reports, and building presentations.
Summarizing data in tables, charts, and graphs, reviewing data for errors and inconsistencies.
Drafting reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
Sharing and actively searching for best practice examples and implementing the approach in their own work whenever possible.
Supporting other team members during client meetings and presentations
Contributing to the team mission by participation in strategic internal projects (coaching, championship, analytical or soft-skills projects) 


Qualifications

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

For this business crucial role, you will have to possess strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills. You will make a difference by helping some of the largest FMCG or T&D clients make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with your colleagues to support the clients in discovering what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance.  You like working with numbers and finding ways to make your work smarter and more efficient. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You want to understand how your work impacts your team and your clients, you are curious, engaged, and accountable.

Qualifications


University degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Total 1-3 years of experience in the FMCG, Retail, or T&D industry and/or related sales, category management, market research, data analytics
Knowledge of NielsenIQ and/or GfK data and systems would be considered as an advantage
An aptitude & desire to build trust and relationships with internal stakeholders, while being open to a client-facing role in future
Strong numerical confidence, data visualization skills, and ability to translate numbers into clear insights and recommendations 
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, conditional functions, conditional formatting, chart building, and formatting), PowerPoint
Fluent communication in English - verbal and written (at least C1 level)
Knowledge of French, German, or Italian is an asset
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time  
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as a team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG and/or T&D industry


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Per Iren Ambiente S.p.A., società del Gruppo specializzata nella gestione di servizi di igiene ambientale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nella Control Room della Direzione Raccolte a Reggio Emilia con il compito di collaborare nell'ambito dei processi di innovazione e digitalizzazione relativi ai servizi operativi di nettezza urbana, raccolta e smaltimento dei rifiuti.


Attività:

-Elaborazione di report e statistiche mediante l'utilizzo di strumenti di B.I.;

-Analisi di dataset specifici finalizzate all'estrazione di insights operativi, utili alla definizione degli interventi migliorativi in ottica di efficienza;

-Calcolo e messa a disposizione di key performance indicator per il monitoraggio dei risultati;

-Monitoraggio dello svolgimento dei servizi di Raccolta e Spazzamento nei vari territori con vigilanza costante degli indicatori;

-Presentazione dei risultati delle analisi effettuate tramite l'utilizzo di data visualization;

-Raccolta, gestione e disamina di tutte le informazioni pertinenti ad un processo aziendale, modellazione e rappresentazione grafica di eventi e implicazioni sul business, comunicazione e condivisione delle informazioni con gli stakeholders al fine di monitorare l'andamento e le performance delle attività;

-Ottimizzazione dei processi.

-Supporto a IT e consulenti esterni per comprendere le esigenze lato business utili al miglioramento delle applicazioni esistenti e alla progettazione di nuove soluzioni.


Competenze:

  • conoscenza di metodologie di analisi dei processi;
  • conoscenza e capacità base di utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence quali Power BI, Qlik...
  • nozioni base di programmazione informatica, utilizzo di sistemi gestionali e di strumenti di reportistica;
  • buone conoscenze di matematica e statistica e correlata capacità di elaborazione, analisi ed interpretazione di dati;
  • capacità di utilizzo di tools di reporting.


Requisiti:

Titolo di studio richiesto:

  • Laurea di estrazione tecnica, preferibilmente in Ingegneria, Informatica o Economia e Commercio;
  • interesse per contesti tecnologici/digitali e sistemi complessi;
  • patente di guida di categoria B;
  • costituirà titolo preferenziale l’aver svolto precedenti esperienze nell’ambito delle aree logistica, trasporti o ciclo di gestione rifiuti.


Forma contrattuale di inserimento: apprendistato professionalizzante.


Sede: Reggio Emilia o, in subordine, Torino, con disponibilità a trasferte su territorio nazionale.


Saranno prese in considerazione esclusivamente le candidature corredate da Curriculum Vitae

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs n. 198/2006) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo:

https://irenfutura.gruppoiren.it/irenlavoraconnoi/portals/0/IREN_InformativaCV_irenfutura.pd

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

This role is part of the newly formed Data Strategy and Stewardship team within the Product organization. This team will be instrumental in shaping the organization’s data landscape. As a Data Analyst, you will support the Data Strategy and Stewardship team in collecting and organizing key information on our data assets, and analyzing this information to develop insights about our data, how it is governed and the value it creates for our enterprise. You will also help ensure that our data and reports meet the highest quality standards. Here are the key aspects of the role:


Establish and analyze our data catalogue:
Partner with key functions including procurement, operations and technology to build a catalogue of all of our data assets including key meta data on each asset (e.g., source, cost, structure, etc)
Analyze and validate data, models and other analytical solutions developed in the team
Partner with the data strategy lead to analyze the data catalogue including assessing the ROI of each data source
Assist the data stewardship team in implementing governance and security standards to protect our data assets
Assist in implementing global data quality standards:
Partner with the data quality team on various activities related to ensuring the accuracy, consistency and reliability of our data products
Activities will include analyzing current quality levels, supporting the implementation of continuous monitoring of data and model Quality Performance Indicators and auditing quality standards
Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities


Qualifications


Preferably 2-3 years of proven working experience as a Data Analyst, Business Data Analyst, or Financial Data Analyst
Experience with data quality audits
A collaborative mindset allowing productive working relationships with global stakeholders
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to link data to the problem to solve
High attention to detail and ability to summarize findings in concise reports
Good written and verbal communication skills in English
Experience managing, analyzing, or interpreting financial or other kinds of sensitive data
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
The ability to learn other software tools as required
Technical skills


Desirable but not mandatory:


Proficient end user of Business Intelligence tools eg. PowerBI, Microstrategy, Qlik
Ability to write basic SQL (select statements)
Basic relational data modelling skills – entity relationship diagrams
Ability to write basic Python notebooks
Ability to research data from public sources eg. Identify ownership of brands and retail businesses; confirm the countries in which a brand is available


WE OFFER


Food vouchers of 70 BGN monthly.
Monthly Hybrid Model Allowance of 51 BGN gross
Additional Medical Insurance, incl Prophylactics, Outpatient care, Inpatient care, Expenses for medications and medical products
Life Insurance
One-time amount of 200 BGN gross for newly born child and for marriage
Additional paid leave of 3 days in case of no overdue leave days from previous year
Birthday allowance of 44 BGN gross
Free access to LinkedIn Learning platform
Multisport card, funded by the employee
Emloyee Assistance Program
In addition:
A Hybrid model of working: part of the week you work from home (home office), a part from the office
The opportunity to gain a valuable experience and knowledge of FMCG on the country and international level
Friendly working environment


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: ANALISTA DE DATOS
Description:
Eres un apasionado de los datos y la tecnología? ¿Te encantaría trabajar en un ambiente joven, dinámico y colaborativo? ¡Entonces esta oportunidad es para ti! Porque en Grupo Petroprix, estamos buscando un/a Analista 𝗱𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗼𝘀 entusiasta y proactivo para unirse a nuestro equipo de Sevilla.




Como Analista 𝗱𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗼𝘀, tus funciones principales incluyen:

Desarrollo y mantenimiento de sistemas de extracción, procesamiento y carga de datos (ETL).
Elaboración de informes y dashboards para ayudar en la toma de decisiones del negocio.
Colaboración con equipos multidisciplinares para desarrollar los sistemas requeridos.
Análisis de clientes y segmentos de cartera.







Algunas cualidades que nos encantaría que tuvieras:




* Titulación universitaria en carrera técnica ( matemáticas, estadística, economía, ingeniería, empresariales, finanzas, física).

*Experiencia en el sector seguros.

*Nivel aceptable de inglés ( B2).

*Experiencia con herramientas de control de versiones ( Git).

*Experiencia con lenguajes de programación, preferiblemente R y SQL.

*Conocimientos de diseño y desarrollo de procesos ETL/ ELT.

*Habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.

*Capacidad de transmitir conceptos técnicos complejos a colaboradores.

*Adaptación a necesidades de las diferentes unidades del negocio.




¿Tienes el perfil ideal que estamos buscando? ¡Genial!




Además, te dejo algunos 𝗲𝘅𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘀 que definitivamente te harán destacar:

Uso profesional de Excel

Conocimientos de Machine Learning.

Conocimientos de desarrollo de aplicaciones ( R Shiny, Streamlit).







En Grupo Petroprix, valoramos la actitud y el compromiso con la excelencia. Ofrecemos un ambiente de trabajo estimulante, oportunidades de crecimiento profesional y un equipo increíblemente colaborativo

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Inetum Team and be part of a work culture focused on innovation!




Location: Lisbon




Main Responsibilities:

Lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that support decision making
Work with the other departments within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards
...




Profile:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
+3 years of experience in data analytics and dashboard development
Professional experience with Tableau, Power BI and Dataiku
Strong experience with PostgreSQL and ETL tools
Excellent communication skills
Team work driven
Fluent English (mandatory)
French B1/B2;
Hybrid work - office in Lisbon (1/2x per week)




Send your CV & join our team!

Title: Analista de datos / Power BI
Description:
En Arelance sabemos que las personas son el activo más importante dentro de una empresa y por tanto invertimos muchos esfuerzos en buscar los mejores profesionales para nuestros clientes y en ofrecer a nuestros candidatos los mejores proyectos.

En este momento buscamos profesionales con experiencia en análisis de datos.

¿Qué buscamos en ti?


Perfil de Analista de datos entre 1 y 2 años de experiencia. Seguimiento de métricas e indicadores. Análisis de datos y tendencias.


Las tareas serían


Seguimiento de indicadores por Ej. CPI SPI cumplimiento SLAs o Seguimiento con los equipos de los proyectos del reporting y cumplimiento de estos indicadores en herramientas internas
Análisis e interpretación de datos
Cálculo de indicadores de calidad de datos para enviar a los responsables de los proyectos.
Cálculo de líneas base de rendimiento de la organización en base a datos recopilados de distintas herramientas internas.
Generación y análisis de diferentes reportes del área que implican cruces de datos de distintas fuentes.
Soporte a los proyecto para el correcto uso de las herramientas internas.


Conocimientos necesarios


Manejo de Excel avanzado (Manejo de pivot tables y fórmulas ej.VLOOKUP COUNTIF COUNTIFS etc. uso y adaptación de macros).
Manejo de Power Point para realizar presentaciones a nivel ejecutivo.
Habilidad con herramientas web
Conocimientos de SQL (Ejecutar consultas existentes a bases de datos y realizar pequeñas modificaciones) PowerBI Dashboards DAX Access


¿Qué valoramos?


Nivel de inglés intermedio/ avanzado


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Incorporación en un proyecto estable
Contrato indefinido
Acceso a formación
Modalidad híbrida/ Málaga


Si tienes interés en una gran oportunidad como ésta ¡inscríbete! ¡Queremos conocerte!

PowerBI, Dashboards, DAX, Access, Excel, SLAs, KPIs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Aluxion we are looking for a highly skilled Data Analyst to join us on a project in the pharmaceutical industry and play a pivotal role in data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for discovering insights from data.

Responsibilities


Ensure the Data Vault architecture aligns with business requirements and best practices in the pharma industry
Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models
Good understanding of business processes in Pharma Technical Operations area and pharmaceutical supply chain models
Project Management: Lead project planning, scheduling, and execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery
Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop and maintain data models, write efficient SQL queries, and design and maintain cloud data warehouses
Performance Analysis: Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) such as CPA, CLV, ROAS, conversion rates, and customer segmentation
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker to communicate insights effectively


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analysis and project management
Experience with Data Vault modeling
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in cloud data warehousing platforms
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Experience in the pharma industry
100% remote job


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with Python programming language
Knowledge of marketing analytics and attribution modeling


If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply!

https://airtable.com/appqZ9UcJmJVegUgx/shrF6n1d0MIG2fHFp

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Place: Villaviciosa de Odón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¿Tienes al menos dos años de experiencia en análisis de datos y estás interesado en trabajar en una Universidad referente en educación? Si tu respuesta es afirmativa, ¡sigue leyendo!




Desde la Universidad Europea buscamos un Data & CRO Assistant con alrededor 2 años de experiencia cuya principal misión será la de ayudar al Data & CRO Analyst en todas sus labores; implementar la estrategia de análisis de datos en los diferentes activos digitales y mercados de la universidad, extraer datos y realizar informes para formular conclusiones y ayuden a tomar decisiones objetivas basadas en el dato.




FUNCIONES




1. Analítica y medición

Análisis de datos y métricas para identificar áreas de mejora y proponer acciones de optimización en los diferentes canales digitales
Seguimiento constante de resultados
Interpretación de datos para extraer insights relevantes y capacidad de traducir las inquietudes de negocio a necesidades analíticas




2. Generación de informes

Definir e implementar informes, paneles de control y cuadros de mando
Proporcionar soporte a los distintos stakeholders on demand o con procesos automatizados




3. CRO

Formular hipótesis
Activar tests en los diferentes canales




4. Ayudar a diseñar la estrategia de datos

Implementar productos de la suite de Google en sitios web, apps, ecommerce y chatbots
Ayudar a definir guías de etiquetado para datalayers
Garantizar el seguimiento y el control de las pautas globales de GA en todos los activos digitales mediante la identificación, interpretación y análisis de KPIs




¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Formación en Marketing Digital. Certificado Google Analytics
Nivel inglés mínimo B2
Imprescindible conocimientos avanzados de Google Analytics 360
Valorable conocimientos de Google Tag Manager, Locker Studio, herramientas de testing, Hotjar
Conocimientos intermedios de lenguajes front-end, Google Ads, Facebook Ads
Clara orientación al cliente y al negocio, capacidad de síntesis, profunda sensibilidad a la calidad del dato, mente analítica




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?




Contrato indefinido a tiempo completo
Modalidad de trabajo: 4 días teletrabajo y 1 día en oficina
Ubicación: Campus Villaviciosa de Odón
Desarrollo y formación profesional
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, en crecimiento y con gran ambiente de trabajo




Si te ves reflejado/a en el perfil, no dudes en inscribirte. ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

  • Desarrollo y formación profesional
  • Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, en crecimiento y con gran ambiente de trabajo


Si te ves reflejado/a en el perfil, no dudes en inscribirte. ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Lisbon.




Responsibilities:

Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.




Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz.
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate).
Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI.
Python skills.
Fluent in English (at least B2).




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / DA”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
