Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We never ask for payment as part of our selection process, and we always contact candidates via our corporate accounts and platforms. If you are approached for payment, this is likely to be fraudulent. Please check to see whether the role you are interested in is posted here, on our website.




Role profile

Purpose of the role

The purpose of this role is to analyze large datasets from various digital platforms utilized within TMF Digital Operations. The goal is to distill these datasets into valuable insights, empowering stakeholders to leverage this intelligence for strategizing and executing the next best action.




Key Functions and Responsibilities

Understanding Business processes and existing ecosystem
Understand Business KPIs, metrics and their calculations
Analyze, understand, and model data being used in the process
Perform Descriptive and Diagnostic analysis on datasets
Identify key insights, relations from data in the context of the Business scenario
Share analysis with Business users
Work collaboratively with Business users and others in team to deliver insights in an agile manner
Ownership of data quality and identification of potential enhancements
Ensure process compliance




Competencies and Skills

The technical skills required for this role are good understanding of database principles and SQL. Ability to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive and inferential statistics. Knowledge of tools like Alteryx will be an added advantage.

Soft skills required include analytical mindset, problem solving ability, excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work in a collaborative environment.




Experience and Qualifications

Have a passion for data analysis and drawing insights from data
Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset
Ability to interpret & ask questions to understand business requirements, to ensure successful business outcomes
Motivation to understand business processes and data platforms to design/deliver scalable data solutions to support customer needs
Good understanding of database principles and SQL, to perform complex analysis
Ensure the consistency and quality of data solutions completed by the engineering team
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly & intuitively
Ability to follow instructions and work in a team environment, adapting to situation & need
Ability to operate using Agile Methodology and DevOps tools, to coordinate, deliver & track work
Can work independently under limited supervision & apply subject knowledge in Data Analysis
Self-motivated and able to proactively learn good practice through research, peer Q&A & experiments
Appreciation of business case fundamentals an advantage, to contribute throughout solution lifecycle
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate solutions to engineering teams and business stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment
Able to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive stats and inferential stats
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
¿Quieres formar parte de una consolidada empresa en el sector del Ocio y Entretenimiento donde se trabaja siempre con las últimas tecnologías?




¡CIRSA es tu lugar!




¡Tenemos una posición de Business Data Analyst para trabajar en nuestras oficinas en Terrassa!




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




⌚ Flexibilidad horaria

📅 Política híbrida de teletrabajo: Nos gusta vernos en la oficina para compartir momentos entre nosotros pero también nos gusta que puedas trabajar des de dónde quieras para conseguir ese buen equilibrio entre la vida laboral y la personal.

✈️ Vacaciones flexibles

🤝 Bonus referral por referenciar a una persona que cumpla con el perfil que buscamos. ¡Tu recomendación es garantía extra de calidad!

💳 Paquete de retribución flexible con beneficios en tributación (tarjeta restaurante, seguro médico, bono transporte, formación o guardería)

📚 Formación continua con un amplio catálogo de cursos a tu alcance

✅ Programa de Becas CIRSA para formarte en lo que quieras

🌱 Empresa comprometida socialmente a través de la ESG

🧘‍♀️ Programas de wellbeing: risoterapia, alimentación saludable, yoga...

🚴 Clubes deportivos CIRSA: running club, bike club y pádel club dónde podrás competir en torneos internos y contra otras empresas.




¿Qué harás con nosotros?




Gestionarás fuentes de datos, identificarás y accederás a las distintas fuentes de información, aplicativos transaccionales corporativos y herramientas de reporting (PowerBi, SAP BO).
Verificarás y te coordinarás con otros departamentos, trabajarás con las divisiones de negocio y las áreas corporativas (especialmente tendrás una interlocución con IT) para asegurar la calidad del dato.
Consolidarás datos, unificando datos provenientes de diferentes sistemas, y crearás modelos para automatizar tareas.
Participarás en la definición de universos de Business Objects y modelos de PowerBi.
Diseñarás y realizarás el mantenimiento de los informes, creando informes adaptados a las necesidades de diferentes destinatarios (informes estáticos e informes interactivos-dinámicos).
Darás soporte a la toma de decisiones, proporcionando información relevante y veraz para la toma de decisiones.
Realizarás análisis de negocio para la consecución de objetivos y mejora de resultados.
Participarás en el despliegue de nuevos proyectos relacionados con la explotación de datos y transformación del negocio.




¿Qué te hará triunfar en la posición?




Te sentirás como en casa si eres una persona organizada, con capacidad de comunicación y de gestión de proyectos.
Que tengas formación en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Economía, Empresa y Tecnología o similar.
Que tengas experiencia previa con herramientas de reporting: Business Objects, PowerBi.
Valoraremos que tengas conocimientos de Snowflake.
Que tengas experiencia en el tratamiento de datos en Excel y presentaciones en Power Point.




Si eres una persona apasionada de tu trabajo y quieres seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional ¡Inscríbete!




“CIRSA es una compañía implicada con la Igualdad de Oportunidades. Por ello, nos responsabilizamos para que nuestros procesos de selección se lleven a cabo en igualdad de condiciones y sin discriminaciones por razón de nacimiento, edad, raza, sexo, orientación sexual, religión, estatus marital, opinión o cualquier otra condición física, personal o social protegida por las leyes”.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 160+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.




Your Mission Will Be

Supporting datamart migration activities, automating processes and centralising information modules.




You Will Need

At least 2 years' professional experience in similar positions;
Experience with datamarts;
Expertise in developing ETL processes (SSIS);
Comfortable with multidimensional modelling concepts;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have

BSc or MSc in Computer Engineering or similar;
Knowledge of Power BI is highly valued;
Fluency in English (Spoken and Written).




With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and little bit a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Show more

Title: Strategic Data Analyst (All Genders)
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Strategic Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be the driving force behind our data-driven decision-making processes, translating complex data into actionable insights. This role is critical for driving strategic initiatives and supporting our organisation's growth.




What will you be doing

You develop and maintain efficient controls to ensure the integrity, accuracy, and completeness of data
You ensure our data environments and platforms remain fit for purpose, supporting management insights, shaping strategy, and facilitating operational processes
You conduct focused analysis on Commercial and Credit Risk outcomes, providing strategic insights
You identify opportunities to enhance and streamline our data strategy
You actively participate in data initiatives and projects
You collaborate effectively with peers and the management team to achieve shared business objectives
You present and communicate results to Senior Management, driving stakeholder discussions
You support line management in delivering functional strategy and objectives, contributing to the development of a high-performing team
You create points of certainty, giving greater confidence to senior stakeholders in driving strategy and decisions




What we are looking for

You hold a degree/diploma or equivalent in an analytical, quantitative, or business-related discipline
You have a proven track record of delivering accurate results within tight deadlines
You possess excellent oral and written communication skills in English and are able to translate insights into a coherent story that drives action
You have a working knowledge of data management environments, tools, and processes (e.g., ETL, data architecture, models, schema structure, visualization solutions)
You are proficient in SAS/SQL at an advanced user level or a suitable alternative language
You can clearly present and visualize the results of data analysis in a way that is easy for others to understand, delivering accurate results within tight deadlines




What you can expect at Barclays

A competitive base salary
Homeoffice (60%remote/40% onsite)
A flexible budget to use at your discretion (payments to employee savings schemes and other solutions)
Significant employer contributions into a company pension scheme
Company sports and fitness activities at special rates
Bonuses on special occasions
Up to 8 free tickets per season for the Barclays Arena
30 days leave (for a 5-day week)
2 work days available for community involvement, charity work or social outreach




Apply now

We're looking for colleagues who are bursting with new ideas and are also full of energy to put them into practice. If you're interested in joining our dynamic team and helping Barclays develop, we would love to meet you. Please send your application with all required documentation (CV, certificates & references).




What Barclays is all about

People are at the heart of everything we do at Barclays — both our customers and our employees. Giving people the opportunity to realise their full potential is incredibly important to us. Each and every one of our employees helps shape and enrich our unique corporate culture. A creative and diverse team is precisely what makes our mission possible, which is to reinvent payments and finance and give people the freedom to live how they want. More than 1.5 million customers are already benefiting from our renowned credit cards, installment loans and even our brand-new financing offer in partnership with Amazon. It's no surprise then that we're one of Germany's leading online banks with more than 700 colleagues in Hamburg.

Title: Junior Consultant – Process Data Analyst
Description:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.




For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.




Role Overview




We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:




Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
Analyzing and interpreting the findings
Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations




Required Technical Skills & Experience:




Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Data Analyst
Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Experience in process analysis and improvement




Preferential requirements are:




1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:

Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…) is a plus
Knowledge of Python highly appreciated




Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.




Protiviti is an equal opportunity employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We establish an open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment process that ensures equal opportunities to all job applicants, free of any direct or indirect discrimination, in compliance with best international standards and applicable law (including but not limited to L. 903/77).

Show more
HTML:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.


For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.


Role Overview


We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:


  • Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
  • Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
  • Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
  • Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
  • Analyzing and interpreting the findings
  • Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
  • Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
  • Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations


Required Technical Skills & Experience:


  • Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
  • Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Data Analyst
  • Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
  • Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
  • Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
  • Experience in process analysis and improvement


Preferential requirements are:


1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:

  • Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
  • Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…) is a plus
  • Knowledge of Python highly appreciated


Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.


Protiviti is an equal opportunity employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We establish an open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment process that ensures equal opportunities to all job applicants, free of any direct or indirect discrimination, in compliance with best international standards and applicable law (including but not limited to L. 903/77).

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst (eDD)
Description:
Job Description

This role is accountable for activities related to Quality checks (Acid tests, Primary testing of data, Retailer Accreditation) from receipt of the data to data loading into the system for data sources that Nielseniq receives. Data Analysts will be responsible for onboarding \ setting up, upload and monitoring data (all Data types) into the ingestion platform \ other input platforms. This role is also responsible for monitoring, cleansing, classification & verification of received data, managing metadata, Troubleshooting, and handling Client queries.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Quality Testing - support all sourcing Teams, operations and Product Leadership with any requests around data quality testing for new / prospective Suppliers
Run Quality checks and provide feedback (Such as Acid test, Retailer Accreditation / other defined quality protocols) on sample data as requested.
Data Onboarding - understand the data format agreed with the Supplier as per the contract and complete set up on Ingestion/ any other Input platform
Data cleaning, verification and classification as needed
Upload of received files to platform as needed
Regularly update Supplier KPIs on data timeliness and Quality (RIS)
Engage with Supplier SPOC - in case data not received on time or issues with the data


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree or technical institute degree / Degrees in statistics/ Data Analytics or equivalent work experience
1-2 years of relevant professional work experience.
Understanding of various data and file formats
Ability to interpret different data structures and mapping


ESSENTIAL SKILLS:


Experience dealing with large amounts of data (TBs) - troubleshooting data issues
Excellent organizational skills & ability to strictly follow schedules
Advanced Excel skills
R, Sql & Python basic knowledge (At least one out of R, Python, SQL ) is an advantage
Strong technical knowledge and business interpretation of data
General NIQ Systems understanding will be a “+”
Advanced in English and Latvian
Good communication skills; excellent analytical skills and detail oriented


WHAT DO WE OFFER?


Private Health Insurance compensation package (after the probation period)
Hybrid working model
Corporate training and development
Volunteer time off


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Title: Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be data-driven and analytical support for global and local clients from FMCG and Tech & Durables industries. An Insight Analyst will be in support of one or several clients, working with internal stakeholders from client-facing NIQ teams, operating as part of a broader international community, working towards a common goal of supporting the clients in achieving their strategic business objectives thanks to insights & recommendations that are critical to our clients' success.

Responsibilities

Supporting internal NIQ stakeholders (Consultants, Account Development, local Insights Teams etc.) in their day-to-day work with the client by:


Building a strong partnership with your internal clients to make an impact delivering best in class projects, managing expectations and priorities following the aligned ways of working
Focusing on stakeholder satisfaction and cultivating productive, long-term connections
Fostering a strong understanding of your clients’ business priorities  
Executing projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data and consumer data, writing client reports, and building presentations.
Summarizing data in tables, charts, and graphs, reviewing data for errors and inconsistencies.
Drafting reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
Sharing and actively searching for best practice examples and implementing the approach in their own work whenever possible.
Supporting other team members during client meetings and presentations
Contributing to the team mission by participation in strategic internal projects (coaching, championship, analytical or soft-skills projects) 


Qualifications

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

For this business crucial role, you will have to possess strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills. You will make a difference by helping some of the largest FMCG or T&D clients make the right choices for their growth strategies. You will partner with your colleagues to support the clients in discovering what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance.  You like working with numbers and finding ways to make your work smarter and more efficient. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You want to understand how your work impacts your team and your clients, you are curious, engaged, and accountable.

Qualifications


University degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Total 1-3 years of experience in the FMCG, Retail, or T&D industry and/or related sales, category management, market research, data analytics
Knowledge of NielsenIQ and/or GfK data and systems would be considered as an advantage
An aptitude & desire to build trust and relationships with internal stakeholders, while being open to a client-facing role in future
Strong numerical confidence, data visualization skills, and ability to translate numbers into clear insights and recommendations 
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, conditional functions, conditional formatting, chart building, and formatting), PowerPoint
Fluent communication in English - verbal and written (at least C1 level)
Knowledge of French, German, or Italian is an asset
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time  
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as a team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG and/or T&D industry


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Per Iren Ambiente S.p.A., società del Gruppo specializzata nella gestione di servizi di igiene ambientale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nella Control Room della Direzione Raccolte a Reggio Emilia con il compito di collaborare nell'ambito dei processi di innovazione e digitalizzazione relativi ai servizi operativi di nettezza urbana, raccolta e smaltimento dei rifiuti.


Attività:

-Elaborazione di report e statistiche mediante l'utilizzo di strumenti di B.I.;

-Analisi di dataset specifici finalizzate all'estrazione di insights operativi, utili alla definizione degli interventi migliorativi in ottica di efficienza;

-Calcolo e messa a disposizione di key performance indicator per il monitoraggio dei risultati;

-Monitoraggio dello svolgimento dei servizi di Raccolta e Spazzamento nei vari territori con vigilanza costante degli indicatori;

-Presentazione dei risultati delle analisi effettuate tramite l'utilizzo di data visualization;

-Raccolta, gestione e disamina di tutte le informazioni pertinenti ad un processo aziendale, modellazione e rappresentazione grafica di eventi e implicazioni sul business, comunicazione e condivisione delle informazioni con gli stakeholders al fine di monitorare l'andamento e le performance delle attività;

-Ottimizzazione dei processi.

-Supporto a IT e consulenti esterni per comprendere le esigenze lato business utili al miglioramento delle applicazioni esistenti e alla progettazione di nuove soluzioni.


Competenze:

  • conoscenza di metodologie di analisi dei processi;
  • conoscenza e capacità base di utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence quali Power BI, Qlik...
  • nozioni base di programmazione informatica, utilizzo di sistemi gestionali e di strumenti di reportistica;
  • buone conoscenze di matematica e statistica e correlata capacità di elaborazione, analisi ed interpretazione di dati;
  • capacità di utilizzo di tools di reporting.


Requisiti:

Titolo di studio richiesto:

  • Laurea di estrazione tecnica, preferibilmente in Ingegneria, Informatica o Economia e Commercio;
  • interesse per contesti tecnologici/digitali e sistemi complessi;
  • patente di guida di categoria B;
  • costituirà titolo preferenziale l’aver svolto precedenti esperienze nell’ambito delle aree logistica, trasporti o ciclo di gestione rifiuti.


Forma contrattuale di inserimento: apprendistato professionalizzante.


Sede: Reggio Emilia o, in subordine, Torino, con disponibilità a trasferte su territorio nazionale.


Saranno prese in considerazione esclusivamente le candidature corredate da Curriculum Vitae

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs n. 198/2006) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo:

https://irenfutura.gruppoiren.it/irenlavoraconnoi/portals/0/IREN_InformativaCV_irenfutura.pd

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Aluxion we are looking for a highly skilled Data Analyst to join us on a project in the pharmaceutical industry and play a pivotal role in data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for discovering insights from data.

Responsibilities


Ensure the Data Vault architecture aligns with business requirements and best practices in the pharma industry
Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models
Good understanding of business processes in Pharma Technical Operations area and pharmaceutical supply chain models
Project Management: Lead project planning, scheduling, and execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery
Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop and maintain data models, write efficient SQL queries, and design and maintain cloud data warehouses
Performance Analysis: Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) such as CPA, CLV, ROAS, conversion rates, and customer segmentation
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker to communicate insights effectively


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analysis and project management
Experience with Data Vault modeling
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in cloud data warehousing platforms
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Experience in the pharma industry
100% remote job


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with Python programming language
Knowledge of marketing analytics and attribution modeling


If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply!

https://airtable.com/appqZ9UcJmJVegUgx/shrF6n1d0MIG2fHFp

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Place: Villaviciosa de Odón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¿Tienes al menos dos años de experiencia en análisis de datos y estás interesado en trabajar en una Universidad referente en educación? Si tu respuesta es afirmativa, ¡sigue leyendo!




Desde la Universidad Europea buscamos un Data & CRO Assistant con alrededor 2 años de experiencia cuya principal misión será la de ayudar al Data & CRO Analyst en todas sus labores; implementar la estrategia de análisis de datos en los diferentes activos digitales y mercados de la universidad, extraer datos y realizar informes para formular conclusiones y ayuden a tomar decisiones objetivas basadas en el dato.




FUNCIONES




1. Analítica y medición

Análisis de datos y métricas para identificar áreas de mejora y proponer acciones de optimización en los diferentes canales digitales
Seguimiento constante de resultados
Interpretación de datos para extraer insights relevantes y capacidad de traducir las inquietudes de negocio a necesidades analíticas




2. Generación de informes

Definir e implementar informes, paneles de control y cuadros de mando
Proporcionar soporte a los distintos stakeholders on demand o con procesos automatizados




3. CRO

Formular hipótesis
Activar tests en los diferentes canales




4. Ayudar a diseñar la estrategia de datos

Implementar productos de la suite de Google en sitios web, apps, ecommerce y chatbots
Ayudar a definir guías de etiquetado para datalayers
Garantizar el seguimiento y el control de las pautas globales de GA en todos los activos digitales mediante la identificación, interpretación y análisis de KPIs




¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Formación en Marketing Digital. Certificado Google Analytics
Nivel inglés mínimo B2
Imprescindible conocimientos avanzados de Google Analytics 360
Valorable conocimientos de Google Tag Manager, Locker Studio, herramientas de testing, Hotjar
Conocimientos intermedios de lenguajes front-end, Google Ads, Facebook Ads
Clara orientación al cliente y al negocio, capacidad de síntesis, profunda sensibilidad a la calidad del dato, mente analítica




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?




Contrato indefinido a tiempo completo
Modalidad de trabajo: 4 días teletrabajo y 1 día en oficina
Ubicación: Campus Villaviciosa de Odón
Desarrollo y formación profesional
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, en crecimiento y con gran ambiente de trabajo




Si te ves reflejado/a en el perfil, no dudes en inscribirte. ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

  • Contrato indefinido a tiempo completo
  • Modalidad de trabajo: 4 días teletrabajo y 1 día en oficina
  • Ubicación: Campus Villaviciosa de Odón
  • Desarrollo y formación profesional
  • Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, en crecimiento y con gran ambiente de trabajo


Si te ves reflejado/a en el perfil, no dudes en inscribirte. ¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Lisbon.




Responsibilities:

Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.
Work effectively with other team members (in various locations), to ensure effective and efficient execution of projects.
Manage several projects and priorities, demonstrating a satisfactory level of autonomy and time management skills.




Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz.
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., TABLEAU Certified Data Analyst, DATAIKU Advanced Designer Certificate).
Experience with other data visualization tools such as POWERBI.
Python skills.
Fluent in English (at least B2).




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / DA”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

• Excellent Python skills

• Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Phone: +31203997864

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We never ask for payment as part of our selection process, and we always contact candidates via our corporate accounts and platforms. If you are approached for payment, this is likely to be fraudulent. Please check to see whether the role you are interested in is posted here, on our website.




Role profile

Purpose of the role

The purpose of this role is to analyze large datasets from various digital platforms utilized within TMF Digital Operations. The goal is to distill these datasets into valuable insights, empowering stakeholders to leverage this intelligence for strategizing and executing the next best action.




Key Functions and Responsibilities

Understanding Business processes and existing ecosystem
Understand Business KPIs, metrics and their calculations
Analyze, understand, and model data being used in the process
Perform Descriptive and Diagnostic analysis on datasets
Identify key insights, relations from data in the context of the Business scenario
Share analysis with Business users
Work collaboratively with Business users and others in team to deliver insights in an agile manner
Ownership of data quality and identification of potential enhancements
Ensure process compliance




Competencies and Skills

The technical skills required for this role are good understanding of database principles and SQL. Ability to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive and inferential statistics. Knowledge of tools like Alteryx will be an added advantage.

Soft skills required include analytical mindset, problem solving ability, excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work in a collaborative environment.




Experience and Qualifications

Have a passion for data analysis and drawing insights from data
Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset
Ability to interpret & ask questions to understand business requirements, to ensure successful business outcomes
Motivation to understand business processes and data platforms to design/deliver scalable data solutions to support customer needs
Good understanding of database principles and SQL, to perform complex analysis
Ensure the consistency and quality of data solutions completed by the engineering team
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly & intuitively
Ability to follow instructions and work in a team environment, adapting to situation & need
Ability to operate using Agile Methodology and DevOps tools, to coordinate, deliver & track work
Can work independently under limited supervision & apply subject knowledge in Data Analysis
Self-motivated and able to proactively learn good practice through research, peer Q&A & experiments
Appreciation of business case fundamentals an advantage, to contribute throughout solution lifecycle
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate solutions to engineering teams and business stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment
Able to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive stats and inferential stats
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
¿Quieres formar parte de una consolidada empresa en el sector del Ocio y Entretenimiento donde se trabaja siempre con las últimas tecnologías?




¡CIRSA es tu lugar!




¡Tenemos una posición de Business Data Analyst para trabajar en nuestras oficinas en Terrassa!




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




⌚ Flexibilidad horaria

📅 Política híbrida de teletrabajo: Nos gusta vernos en la oficina para compartir momentos entre nosotros pero también nos gusta que puedas trabajar des de dónde quieras para conseguir ese buen equilibrio entre la vida laboral y la personal.

✈️ Vacaciones flexibles

🤝 Bonus referral por referenciar a una persona que cumpla con el perfil que buscamos. ¡Tu recomendación es garantía extra de calidad!

💳 Paquete de retribución flexible con beneficios en tributación (tarjeta restaurante, seguro médico, bono transporte, formación o guardería)

📚 Formación continua con un amplio catálogo de cursos a tu alcance

✅ Programa de Becas CIRSA para formarte en lo que quieras

🌱 Empresa comprometida socialmente a través de la ESG

🧘‍♀️ Programas de wellbeing: risoterapia, alimentación saludable, yoga...

🚴 Clubes deportivos CIRSA: running club, bike club y pádel club dónde podrás competir en torneos internos y contra otras empresas.




¿Qué harás con nosotros?




Gestionarás fuentes de datos, identificarás y accederás a las distintas fuentes de información, aplicativos transaccionales corporativos y herramientas de reporting (PowerBi, SAP BO).
Verificarás y te coordinarás con otros departamentos, trabajarás con las divisiones de negocio y las áreas corporativas (especialmente tendrás una interlocución con IT) para asegurar la calidad del dato.
Consolidarás datos, unificando datos provenientes de diferentes sistemas, y crearás modelos para automatizar tareas.
Participarás en la definición de universos de Business Objects y modelos de PowerBi.
Diseñarás y realizarás el mantenimiento de los informes, creando informes adaptados a las necesidades de diferentes destinatarios (informes estáticos e informes interactivos-dinámicos).
Darás soporte a la toma de decisiones, proporcionando información relevante y veraz para la toma de decisiones.
Realizarás análisis de negocio para la consecución de objetivos y mejora de resultados.
Participarás en el despliegue de nuevos proyectos relacionados con la explotación de datos y transformación del negocio.




¿Qué te hará triunfar en la posición?




Te sentirás como en casa si eres una persona organizada, con capacidad de comunicación y de gestión de proyectos.
Que tengas formación en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Economía, Empresa y Tecnología o similar.
Que tengas experiencia previa con herramientas de reporting: Business Objects, PowerBi.
Valoraremos que tengas conocimientos de Snowflake.
Que tengas experiencia en el tratamiento de datos en Excel y presentaciones en Power Point.




Si eres una persona apasionada de tu trabajo y quieres seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional ¡Inscríbete!




“CIRSA es una compañía implicada con la Igualdad de Oportunidades. Por ello, nos responsabilizamos para que nuestros procesos de selección se lleven a cabo en igualdad de condiciones y sin discriminaciones por razón de nacimiento, edad, raza, sexo, orientación sexual, religión, estatus marital, opinión o cualquier otra condición física, personal o social protegida por las leyes”.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 160+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.




Your Mission Will Be

Supporting datamart migration activities, automating processes and centralising information modules.




You Will Need

At least 2 years' professional experience in similar positions;
Experience with datamarts;
Expertise in developing ETL processes (SSIS);
Comfortable with multidimensional modelling concepts;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have

BSc or MSc in Computer Engineering or similar;
Knowledge of Power BI is highly valued;
Fluency in English (Spoken and Written).




With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and little bit a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Tableau Data Analyst x 2

Location: Spain (hybrid)

Contract Type: Indefinite




Haybury are seeking two independent Tableau Data Analysts to support separate stakeholders in delivering high-quality data insights and visualizations. This role will interact directly with one of our leading global pharmaceutical organisations in Spain.




Each role involves working closely with respective stakeholders to refine requirements, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and implement solutions using Tableau. The ideal candidates will be experienced in Tableau, capable of working independently, and proficient in translating business needs into actionable insights through data visualization.




Key Responsibilities:




Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, refine requirements, and define KPIs
Leverage Tableau to create effective data visualizations and dashboards that support decision-making
Conduct data analysis to generate insights and solutions tailored to business requirements
Translate technical requirements into clear, actionable business insights
Work independently on development tasks in Tableau, managing your own projects from conception to delivery
Collaborate with team members focused on data modeling and ETL processes (data ingestion is handled by a separate team)
Support functional analysis by working closely with stakeholders to understand their data and business problems




Requirements:




Minimum of 3+ years of experience in Tableau development, including building visualizations and dashboards
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing data
Experience in data visualization and creating compelling, user-friendly reports
Proven ability in stakeholder management with the ability to communicate technical concepts in business terms
Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to work independently, managing multiple priorities with little oversight
Functional experience in understanding and defining business problems and data needs




If you have the skills and experience for this opportunity, then please apply or email Rory your CV today to rory.pitts@hayburysearch.com.




Rory is a Search Consultant at Haybury Search covering Europe, UK, North America and Asia.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?




Optimissa es una empresa de consultoría IT especializada en Financial Services, siempre en búsqueda permanente de los mayores entusiastas de la Consultoría. Intentamos reinventarnos constantemente para así poder ofrecer el mejor lugar para que nuestros colaboradores puedan desarrollar su carrera y la mejor alternativa como partner para nuestros clientes. Desarrolla tu carrera y escribe tu propia historia.




Nuestros Proyectos




Se caracterizan por un alto grado de complejidad, realizando labores de arquitectura, análisis y desarrollo. Construimos aplicaciones ad-hoc y producto propio para áreas de inversión de las principales entidades financieras.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia con PowerBI
Experiencia en BBDD relacionales: SQL.
Conocimientos de Cognos para referencia de informes antiguos




Modalidad: Trabajo presencial en Madrid.




Ofrecemos:




Incorporación estable - Contrato Indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Plan de carrera profesional
Salario negociable según experiencia
Plan de Retribución Flexible: combinación de salario base + beneficios que se adaptan a tus circunstancias (Ticket restaurant, seguro médico, ticket transporte)
Ubicación: Madrid




Si has seguido leyendo hasta aquí, cumples los requisitos....¡Únete a Optimissa!

Desarrolla tu carrera y escribe tu propia historia.


Nuestros Proyectos


Se caracterizan por un alto grado de complejidad, realizando labores de arquitectura, análisis y desarrollo. Construimos aplicaciones ad-hoc y producto propio para áreas de inversión de las principales entidades financieras.


¿Qué buscamos?


  • Experiencia con PowerBI
  • Experiencia en BBDD relacionales: SQL.
  • Conocimientos de Cognos para referencia de informes antiguos


Modalidad: Trabajo presencial en Madrid.


Ofrecemos:


  • Incorporación estable - Contrato Indefinido
  • Excelente ambiente de trabajo
  • Plan de carrera profesional
  • Salario negociable según experiencia
  • Plan de Retribución Flexible: combinación de salario base + beneficios que se adaptan a tus circunstancias (Ticket restaurant, seguro médico, ticket transporte)
  • Ubicación: Madrid


Si has seguido leyendo hasta aquí, cumples los requisitos....¡Únete a Optimissa!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
More digital. More human. More Minsait.

En Minsait creemos en un futuro digital más humano; por eso, ofrecemos proyectos tecnológicos que transforman los negocios y nos permiten crecer como profesionales desde una cultura inspiradora y flexible.




Buscamos Data Analyst para importantes proyectos nacionales, con ganas de unirse a nuestros equipos multidisciplinares. Si te apasionan los proyectos retadores y quieres generar impacto social, sostenible y tangible, ¡sigue leyendo!







¿Qué esperamos por tu parte?

Experiencia en modelado de datos.
Experiencia en construcción de procesos ETL con alta volumetría
Nivel alto de SQL
Conocimientos de Powercenter y SSIS.
Se valorará experiencia previa en desarrollo con .NET.
Se valorará experiencia previa con SSRS.







Sé parte de un futuro más humano. Motivos por los que te encantará ser un #Minsaiter:

Compañía Top Employer con más de 45.000 profesionales y con acceso a proyectos retadores.
Conciliación y equilibrio: podrás disfrutar de 32 días laborables de descanso, jornada intensiva en verano y teletrabajo.
Carrera profesional y formación continua adaptada a tus necesidades y motivaciones.
Contrato Indefinido y retribución competitiva, seguro de vida y acceso a planes de retribución flexible: cheques restaurante, cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte o seguro médico privado.
Programa de bienestar con acceso a una red de gimnasios, servicio de telemedicina en línea gratuita y otras ventajas como aplicaciones para hacer tu declaración de la renta más fácil, asesoría legal gratuita y nuestra Privilege Store.
Cultura empática, humana y flexible: promovemos un liderazgo cercano marcado por la colaboración y el trabajo en equipo. Contamos con espacios donde podrás compartir tus aficiones, hobbies e intereses con otros profesionales y si quieres dejar tu huella en el mundo, no dudes en participar en nuestro programa de voluntariado.

Minsait, technology for a more human future!

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Job Description

Responsibilities: The Data Analyst investigates, documents, and offers solutions to data collection and data quality problems, including functional requirements, needed workflows, and accompanying data plans to improvements, close gaps, and to support the development of new applications and workflows within our technology environments. As such he/she must be versatile, a quick learner, and an excellent communicator and translator to understand and clearly express these concepts to the stakeholders involved. This position must be able to communicate to both technical and non-technical staff and to translate concepts between those groups. Insufficient buy-in, resistance to change, and skill deficits are all challenges that will be faced by the incumbent in this position.

  • Acts as a liaison between Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department and other DOL Business Units;
  • Develops and reviews specifications for enhancements to the DOL's Enterprise Applications and associated database environments;
  • Determines which research method to use and how to proceed with research and analysis;
  • Determines which strategy is best for processing data and producing reports;
  • Extract data from various sources (data warehouse, SQL tables, Excel, among others). Work closely with system owners to define/redefine developed models;
  • Filter and "clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems;
  • Perform analysis on report/query results to ensure accuracy in reporting and recommend solutions;
  • Identify patterns and trends in data sets and recommend changes/solutions to problems;
  • Define new data collection and analysis processes;
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality;
  • Design processes that operationalize the use of data in business decision making;
  • Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Supports the organization's key business processes and applications;
  • Gathers and documents business requirements;
  • Translates requirements into business, functional, and use case documents or operational artifacts; 3 of 4
  • Develops data plans to support application development;
  • Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs;
  • Test solution requests prior to implementation;
  • Generate reports, visuals, and presentations;
  • Assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals;
  • Alert the Project Manager to any "out of scope” activity;
  • Develop and maintain project information with collaboration tools such as SharePoint;
  • Maintain records of time spent on assigned tasks and provide information as required for project management and other administrative purposes;
  • Assists in the creation and delivery of related user documentation and end-user training when requested; and
  • Performs other related duties as required. In practice, the position requires not only general technical expertise, but also specific substantive knowledge of the breadth and depth of the DOL business operations agency-wide, as well as the technical platforms, so that the challenges can be met. In meeting these challenges, the Data Analyst must display the following job competencies:
  • Supports the DOL's Mission, Ethics and Values in keeping with the general operational standards of the department;
  • Develops productive relationships with our customers and builds Subject Matter Expertise in their fields during engagements;
  • Understands and translates business unit functions and how information service operations, specialized tools, and software facilitate those functions. Uses this understanding to communicate value propositions and risk mitigation for proposed engagements and use case documents;
  • Demonstrates a commitment to continuously improve their knowledge of fast changing computer programs, hardware and software through professional development;
  • Provides exemplary customer service in a courteous and professional manner at all times to all DOL staff and the public we serve;
  • Works with others cooperatively, demonstrating a willingness to be a team player, and contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals;
  • Accurately assesses workflow, data, and other process related problems. Recommends and facilitates best fit solutions. . Qualifications: Minimum Entrance Requirements:
  • Knowledge of and ability to work with business data analysis, query design principles, data visualization, and/or statistical analysis.
  • Knowledge of business data analytics and use of business intelligence and technical tools to source and organize data.
  • Ability to create, prepare and present visual data and to engage in public speaking.
  • Ability to problem solve, use deductive and inductive reasoning, and apply critical thinking skills to complex matters.
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 4 of 4
  • Ability to use data analysis and business intelligence to interpret trends to support business activity.
  • Ability to prepare recommendations, reports and revisions based on business data analytics.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with colleagues, superiors and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of the methods of statistical report writing.
  • Knowledge of project management and business planning.
  • Ability to adapt to new tools and concepts in the field of Data Analytics. Preferred Qualifications:
  • Strong customer service skills;
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to balance, prioritize and organize multiple tasks;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in teams and across organizations;
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly;
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships inside and outside the organization;
  • Basic analytical skills to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, consolidate details and extract to functional requirements;
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively translate user requirements into business, functional and test scenarios for projects of various sizes and complexity;
  • Knowledge of formal software development life cycle methodologies;
  • Experience preparing technical documentation, including business process models, cross functional flow charts, data catalogs, technical project SOWs and project plans, and performance analysis documents. Ability to analyze complex issues and information relating to systems and programs;
  • Experience in designing program integrity checks;
  • Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical people effectively;
  • Ability to work effectively alone and as member of a team;
  • Ability to perform tasks as directed by management About Kyyba: Founded in 1998 and headquartered in Farmington Hills, MI, Kyyba has a global presence delivering high-quality resources and top-notch recruiting services, enabling businesses to effectively respond to organizational changes and technological advances. At Kyyba, the overall well-being of our employees and their families is important to us. We are proud of our work culture which embodies our core values; incorporating value, passion, excellence, empowerment, and happiness, creates a vibrant and productive atmosphere. We empower our employees with the resources, incentives, and flexibility that they need to support a healthy, balanced, and fulfilling career by providing many valuable benefits and a balanced compensation structure combined with career development. Disclaimer: Kyyba is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Kyyba does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Individuals with Disabilities are encouraged to apply. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Rewards: Medical, dental, vision 401k Term life Voluntary life and disability insurance Optional Pre-paid legal plan Optional Identity theft plan Optional Medical and dependent FSA Work-visa sponsorship Opportunity for advancement Long-term assignment with opportunity for hire by client

SELECT AWARDS

  • An INC 5000 company for 10 years
  • Corp! Michigan Economic Bright Spots
  • Crain’s Detroit Business Top Staffing Service Companies in Detroit
  • TechServe Alliance Excellence Award- IT and Engineering Staffing & Solutions
  • Best of MichBusiness winner in HR Wizards & Partnerships
  • Metro Detroit Elite Category: Recruitment, Selection & Orientation for 101 Best & Brightest
  • 101 Best & Brightest Companies to Work for in Michigan

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

--

Are you passionate about shaping the future of data ecosystems? We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the architecture of our cutting-edge data platform. At Material Bank, you'll play a pivotal role in building a modern data infrastructure utilizing advanced technologies like real-time data streams and machine learning-powered insights.

In this role, you'll integrate various data initiatives into a unified schema, establishing a single source of truth across the organization. Your expertise will be critical in defining universal schemas, rationalizing domain data and structures, and empowering our team to make data-driven decisions. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to both B2B and B2C products, impacting high-profile projects that will shape the future of Material Bank.

What you’ll do:


Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.



What you’ll bring:


3+ Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
Experience with data visualization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment



What you’ll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.
